text: Imma homalotis is a moth in the family Immidae. It was described by Edward Meyrick in 1906. It is found on Borneo. The wingspan is 21–22 mm. The forewings are rather dark ochreous fuscous, anteriorly slightly purplish tinged. The hindwings are dark fuscous, somewhat lighter towards the base.Transactions of the Entomological Society of London. 1906 (2): 187. ==References== Category:Moths described in 1906 Category:Immidae Category:Moths of Asia
title: Imma homalotis
